book.name: Malachi
book.info: The Israelites who had returned from captivity.
book.subject: Jehovah's Dealing with the Sons of Levi (the Priests among Israel) and with the Sons of Jacob (the People of Israel)

outlines.outline: Jehovah's dealing with the sons of Levi
The priests' breaking of Jehovah's commandment and their corrupting of Jehovah's covenant
The treachery of Judah (actually the priests) and their profaneness toward Jehovah
Jehovah's hatred of the treachery of man (mainly referring to the priests) toward his wife
To refine and purify the priests by His coming as the messenger of Jehovah
Jehovah's dealing with the sons of Jacob
Jehovah's judgment by His drawing near
Jehovah's advice to the sons of Jacob
Jehovah's encouragement to those who fear Him and serve Him
The words of some of the sons of Jacob being strongly against Jehovah
The word of encouragement by Jehovah
Jehovah's warning by the day of Jehovah

verse.text: The burden of the word of Jehovah to Israel through [note]1[/note]Malachi.
verse.note: Meaning [i]the messenger of Jah[/i] ([i]Jah[/i] being a shortened form of [i]Jehovah[/i]), or [i]My messenger[/i] (cf. [link]3:1[/link]). The name indicates that Malachi was a messenger of God to minister the word of God to His people Israel.[br/][br/]The central thought of Malachi's prophecy is the correcting of the priests among Israel for the coming of Christ as the Messenger of God ([link]3:1a[/link]) and the advising of the people of Israel for the appearing of Christ as the Sun of righteousness ([link]4:2[/link]).

verse.text: I have [xref]a[/xref]loved you, says Jehovah; but you say, How have You loved us? Was not Esau Jacob's brother, declares Jehovah? Yet I loved [xref]b[/xref]Jacob;
But Esau I hated, and I made his mountains a [xref]a[/xref]desolation, and [i]gave[/i] his inheritance to the jackals of the wilderness.

Though [note]1[/note]Edom says, We are beaten down, but we will return and build up the waste places; thus says Jehovah of hosts, They will build up, but I will throw down; and they will be called the territory of wickedness and the people with whom Jehovah is indignant forever.
verse.note: A nation of the descendants of Esau ([link]Gen. 36:1[/link]), the twin brother of Jacob.

verse.text: And your eyes will see [i]it,[/i] and you yourselves will say, Jehovah is magnified [note]1[/note]over the territory of Israel.
verse.note: Here [i]over the territory of Israel[/i] means outside that territory. Even though the nation of Edom has been condemned and the people of Edom are the object of God's indignation, even in Edom, outside Israel, Jehovah will be magnified.

verse.text: A son honors [i]his[/i] father, and a servant his lord. Therefore if I am a [xref]a[/xref]Father, where is My [xref]b[/xref]honor? And if I am the [xref]c[/xref]Lord, where is My [xref]d[/xref]fear? says Jehovah of hosts to you, O priests who despise My name. But you say, How have we despised Your name?
You offer defiled food upon My altar. And you say, How have we defiled You? In that you say, The [xref]a[/xref]table of Jehovah is despicable.

And when you offer what is blind as a sacrifice, is it not evil? And when you offer what is lame and sick, is it not evil? Present it, if you will, to your governor. Will he be pleased with you or accept your person? says Jehovah of hosts.
And now, if you will, entreat the favor of God, that He may be gracious to us. This is what is from your hand. Will He accept any of your persons? says Jehovah of hosts.

Oh, that there were even someone among you who would shut the doors so that you would not kindle [i]fire[/i] on My altar in vain! I have no delight in you, says Jehovah of hosts; and I am not pleased with the sacrifice from your hand.

For from the [xref]a[/xref]rising of the sun even unto its setting My name will be great among the nations. And in every place incense will be offered to My name as well as a pure sacrifice, for My name will be great among the nations, says Jehovah of hosts.
But you profane it by saying, The [xref]a[/xref]table of the Lord is defiled, and the produce on it, its food, is despicable.

And you say, Ah, how tiresome it is! and sniff at it [i]in contempt,[/i] says Jehovah of hosts. Then you bring what has been stolen and what is lame and what is sick, and you offer [i]it as[/i] a sacrifice. Should I be pleased with what [i]comes[/i] from your hand? says Jehovah.

Rather, cursed be the deceiver who has in his flock a male, and when he makes a vow, he offers what is [xref]a[/xref]blemished to the Lord; for I am a great [xref]b[/xref]King, says Jehovah of hosts, and My name is feared among the nations.
And now this commandment is for you, O priests.

If you will not hear and take it to heart to give glory to My name, says Jehovah of hosts, I will send the curse among you, and I will curse your blessings; indeed I have cursed them [i]already[/i] because you have not taken [i]it[/i] to heart.
I will rebuke your seed and spread dung upon your faces, the dung of your feasts; and they will take you away with it.
And you will know that I have sent this commandment to you, that My [xref]a[/xref]covenant may remain with Levi, says Jehovah of hosts.
My [xref]a[/xref]covenant was with him as life and peace; and I gave these to him that he might fear; and he did fear Me, and he did stand in awe of My name.
The law of truth was in his mouth, and no wrong was found in his lips; in peace and uprightness he walked with Me, and he turned many away from iniquity.
For the priest's lips should keep knowledge, and [i]men[/i] should seek instruction from his mouth, for he is the [xref]a[/xref]messenger of Jehovah of hosts.
But you have turned away from the way; you have caused many to [xref]a[/xref]stumble at the law; you have corrupted the covenant of Levi, says Jehovah of hosts.
Therefore I also have made you despicable and base before all the people to the same extent that you have not kept My ways but have been respecters of persons in the law.
Have we not all [xref]a[/xref]one Father? Has not [xref]b[/xref]one God created us? Why are we treacherous, each one to his brother, thus profaning the covenant of our fathers?

Judah has been treacherous, and an abomination has been done in Israel and in Jerusalem; for Judah has profaned the [xref]a[/xref]sanctuary of Jehovah, which He loves, and has married the daughter of a foreign god.
As regards the man who does [i]this,[/i] Jehovah will cut off from the tents of Jacob him who wakes and him who answers and him who offers a sacrifice to Jehovah of hosts.
And this second thing you do: You cover the altar of Jehovah with tears, with weeping and sighing, so that He no longer regards the sacrifice or receives [i]it[/i] with pleasure from your hand.

Yet you say, For what reason? Because Jehovah has been the witness between you and the [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]wife of your youth, to whom you have been treacherous; yet she is your companion and your wife of [xref]b[/xref]covenant.
verse.note: [link]Verses 13-14[/link] indicate that the treachery of a priest toward his wife damages his priesthood. If a servant of the Lord cannot live properly with his wife, his service will be annulled.

verse.text: But [xref]a[/xref]did He not make [i]them[/i] one? And the remnant of the Spirit was His. And why the one? He sought the [note]1[/note]seed of God. Take heed then to your [note]2[/note]spirit, and let no one be treacherous to the wife of his youth.
verse.note: In marriage God has made the husband and wife one in order to produce "the seed of God," i.e., godly children.

Our spirit is the source of our conduct. God cares for our spirit ([link]Zech. 12:1[/link]), and we must take heed to it (cf. [link]Acts 24:16[/link]; [link]Rom. 8:4-6[/link]; [link]2 Cor. 2:13[/link]).

verse.text: For I hate [xref]a[/xref]divorce, says Jehovah the God of Israel; and he [i]who does it[/i] [note]1[/note]behaves in violence, says Jehovah of hosts. Take heed then to your spirit, and do not be treacherous.
verse.note: In the sight of God, divorce is a violent act.

verse.text: You have wearied Jehovah with your words; but you say, How have we wearied [i]Him?[/i] By saying, Everyone who does evil is good in the sight of Jehovah, and He delights in them; or, Where is the God of justice?

I am about to [xref]a[/xref]send [note]1[/note]My messenger, and he will [xref]b[/xref]clear the way before Me; and suddenly the Lord, whom you seek, will come to His temple. And the [note]2[/note][xref]c[/xref]Angel of the covenant, whom you [note]3[/note][xref]d[/xref]desire, He will come, says Jehovah of hosts.
verse.note: Heb. [i]malachi[/i]. First, this prophecy concerning the coming of Jehovah's messenger was fulfilled in the coming of the prophet Malachi, a type of Christ as the coming One. Second, this prophecy was fulfilled in the first coming of Christ with John the Baptist as His forerunner ([link]Isa. 40:3-5[/link]; [link]Matt. 11:7-13[/link]). In His first coming Christ came as a Messenger and even as the message sent by God. As the Messenger of God, Christ not only brings a word or a message from God to God's people; He Himself is the living message. This is proven by the four Gospels, which are a complete and perfect record of Christ as the living message sent by God to His chosen people (see note [link]2[sup]2[/sup] in Heb. 1[/link]). As God's Messenger Christ came to adjust, refine, and purify the priests. In the Gospels the Lord Jesus frequently rebuked the priests. Third, this prophecy will be fulfilled in the second coming of Christ with Elijah as His forerunner ([link]4:5[/link] and note).

Or, Messenger. Christ's coming suddenly as the Angel of the covenant will be to execute upon Israel the covenant that He enacted through His death ([link]Matt. 26:28[/link]). In His first coming Christ came in the way of an Angel, a serving one (cf. [link]Heb. 1:14[/link]), to serve God in forming the new testament ([link]Mark 10:45[/link]). When He established His table on the night in which He was betrayed, He enacted the new covenant ([link]Luke 22:20[/link]), in which God is obligated to forgive our sins and to dispense Himself into our being to be our life, our law of life, and our everything as our inward content that we may live Him ([link]Jer. 31:31-34[/link]; [link]Heb. 8:8-12[/link]). As the Angel of the covenant, Christ in resurrection executes the new covenant as its surety ([link]Heb. 7:22[/link]), making it real to us by assuring us that our sins have been forgiven and by dispensing the riches of the covenanted Triune God into us. See notes [link book="Jer." chapter="31"]31[sup]1[/sup][/link], [link]33[sup]1[/sup][/link], and [link]33[sup]2[/sup] in Jer. 31[/link].[br/][br/]Although the Lord Jesus enacted the new covenant nearly two thousand years ago, generally the Jewish people have not benefited from it. Instead, the benefit has gone to the Gentiles. However, when Christ comes back, He will come as the Angel of the covenant to execute His covenant over the repentant and believing Jews. At that time they will become beneficiaries of the new covenant.
Cf. [link]Hag. 2:7[/link] and note.

verse.text: And who will endure the [xref]a[/xref]day of His coming? And who will [xref]b[/xref]stand when He appears? For He is like a [note]1[/note]refiner's [xref]c[/xref]fire and like fullers' soap.
verse.note: Christ will come also to refine and purify the sons of Levi, mainly the priests, like a refiner's fire and like fuller's soap that they may offer to God the proper sacrifice ([link]vv. 2-4[/link]). In the millennium the repentant Jews who are regenerated through the new covenant will be the priests to care for all the nations ([link]Isa. 2:2-3[/link]; [link]Zech. 8:20-23[/link]). For this they will need much refining and purifying. Therefore, in His second coming Christ will renew, sanctify, and transform Israel to be His refined and purified priests.

verse.text: And He will sit as a [xref]a[/xref]refiner and a purifier of silver, and He will purify the sons of Levi and purge them like gold and like silver, and they will offer to Jehovah a sacrifice in righteousness.
And the sacrifice of Judah and of Jerusalem will be pleasing to Jehovah, as in the days of old and as in the former years.

And I will draw near to you for judgment; and I will be a swift witness against the sorcerers and against the adulterers and against those who swear falsely and against those who [xref]a[/xref]oppress the hired worker for his hire, [i]and[/i] the widow and the orphan, and those who turn the [note]1[/note]stranger aside, and who do not fear Me, says Jehovah of hosts.
verse.note: Jehovah's concern for the stranger indicates that as Christ He is very human and that He is not happy when His people ill-treat a stranger instead of giving him hospitality.

verse.text: For I, Jehovah, do [xref]a[/xref]not change; therefore you, O sons of Jacob, are [xref]b[/xref]not consumed.

From the days of your fathers you have turned aside from My statutes and have not kept [i]them.[/i] [xref]a[/xref]Return to Me, and I will return to you, says Jehovah of hosts. But you say, How shall we return?
Will a man [note]1[/note]rob God? Yet you have robbed Me. But you say, How have we robbed You? In [xref]a[/xref]tithes and offerings.
verse.note: To rob God is to not give Him what is due to Him. God established the principle that of all the produce from the land, one tenth (the tithe), the top tenth, should go to Him ([link]Lev. 27:30[/link]).

verse.text: With the curse you are cursed, yet you, [i]even[/i] the whole nation, rob Me.

Bring the whole [xref]a[/xref]tithe to the storehouse that there may be [note]1[/note]food in My house; and prove Me, if you will, by this, says Jehovah of hosts, whether I will open to you the [xref]b[/xref]windows of heaven and pour out [note]2[/note][xref]c[/xref]blessing for you until there is no room for it.
verse.note: The food in God's house is not for man but for God. God's food, the divine food, is the offerings, especially the burnt offering, the meal offering, and the peace offering ([link]Num. 28:2[/link]; [link]29:39[/link]), all of which typify Christ (see notes in [link]Lev. 1-7[/link]).
To be blessed by God here and in [link]v. 12[/link] is to be healed ([link]4:2[/link]). To be healed is to be saved, and to be saved is to be made whole.

verse.text: And I will rebuke the devourer for your sake, and for your sake he will not destroy the fruit of the ground; and for your sake the vine will not lose its fruit in the field, says Jehovah of hosts.
And all the nations will call you [xref]a[/xref]blessed, for you will be a [xref]b[/xref]land of delight, says Jehovah of hosts.
Your words have been strongly [xref]a[/xref]against Me, says Jehovah; but you say, What have we spoken against You?
You say, It is vain to serve God; and what profit is it that we have kept His charge and have walked [note]1[/note]mournfully before Jehovah of hosts?
verse.note: This word indicates that the children of Israel worshipped and served God, but they did it mournfully, not at all happy that they were required to do these things.

verse.text: And now we call the arrogant blessed; not only have those who act wickedly been built up, but they also try God and escape.

Then those who feared Jehovah spoke to one another, each with his neighbor. And Jehovah gave heed and listened, and a [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]book of remembrance was written before Him of those who feared Jehovah and considered His name.
verse.note: When we consider, love, regard, respect, and sanctify God's name, God keeps a record of this in His book of remembrance.

verse.text: And they will be [xref]a[/xref]Mine, says Jehovah of hosts, a personal treasure, in the [note]1[/note]day that I prepare; and I will spare them, as a man spares his son who serves him.
verse.note: The day of God's anger, i.e., the day of Jehovah. See note [link]15[sup]1[/sup] in Joel 1[/link].

verse.text: And you will return and discern between him who is righteous and him who is wicked, between him who serves God and him who does not serve Him.

For indeed the [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]day comes, [xref]b[/xref]burning like a furnace, and all the proud ones and all the ones who act wickedly will be [xref]c[/xref]stubble; and the coming day will set them ablaze, says Jehovah of hosts, so that it will not leave them root or branch.
verse.note: See note [link]17[sup]1[/sup] in ch. 3[/link].

verse.text: But unto you who fear My name will the [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]Sun of righteousness arise with [note]2[/note][xref]b[/xref]healing in His wings, and you will go forth and leap about like well-fed calves.
verse.note: The healing Christ, who Himself is the healing of God's people and of the nations. Christ is the Sun that heals us as it shines upon us. Christ's being our healing is based on His being the Sun of righteousness. The word Sun indicates life (cf. [link]John 1:4[/link]), and the word righteousness indicates justice. The whole earth is filled with death and injustice, but with the healing Christ there is life and justice. Today we, the believers in Christ, enjoy Christ's shining as the Sun of righteousness for our growth in life in the dispelling of darkness, and also for our healing in life in the effacing of unrighteousness. Our hope, our expectation, is that Christ is coming as the Sun of righteousness with healing in His wings to heal the nations from darkness and unrighteousness. We are waiting for Him as the Desire of the nations ([link]3:1b[/link]; [link]Hag. 2:7b[/link]) and as the Sun of righteousness.[br/][br/]In relation to Israel, Christ came the first time to heal the degraded priesthood ([link]3:1-4[/link]), but in His second coming, He will heal the remnant of the people of Israel. Then He will be everything to the nations and to His people. This healing Christ will come suddenly. Thus, we need to be alert, ready to receive Him.
See note [link]10[sup]2[/sup] in ch. 3[/link].

verse.text: And you will trample the wicked, for they will be ashes under the soles of your feet in the day that I prepare, says Jehovah of hosts.
Remember the [xref]a[/xref]law of Moses My servant, which I commanded him in [xref]b[/xref]Horeb for all Israel, [i]that is,[/i] the [note]1[/note]statutes and the [note]1[/note]ordinances.
verse.note: See note [link]6[sup]4[/sup] in Luke 1[/link].

verse.text: I am about to send [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]Elijah the prophet to you before the great and terrible [note]2[/note][xref]b[/xref]day of Jehovah comes;
verse.note: This refers to the coming of Elijah as one of the two witnesses during the great tribulation ([link]Matt. 24:21[/link]). See [link]Matt. 17:11[/link] and note; [link]Rev. 11:3[/link] and note 2.
See note [link]15[sup]1[/sup] in Joel 1[/link].

verse.text: And he will [xref]a[/xref]turn the heart of the fathers to the children and the heart of the children to their fathers, lest I come and strike the land with a [xref]b[/xref]curse.
